info.game_comments:
1990 College Championship final game 2.
The Double Jeopardy! board is seen on the cover of The Jeopardy! Book.

(1, 1).clue: The first gorilla born in captivity was born in this Ohio city's zoo in 1956

(2, 1).clue: This actor turned 13 years old on July 9, 1989 -- that's 13 "Wonder Years" old

(3, 1).clue: In this game the "scotch" refers to a line

(4, 1).clue: "Spooky" term for a person who writes a book for someone else

(5, 1).clue: If you walk on grass in early morning, you might step on these tiny waterdrops condensed from the air

(6, 1).clue: Pyramus & she didn't have a ball for they were separated by a wall

(1, 2).clue: Franklin Pierce had a home in & is buried in this New Hampshire capital

(3, 2).clue: In some versions of this game a crowned piece becomes a "queen", not a king

(4, 2).clue: You don't have to be a bee to know this 6-letter synonym for "bungle" or "blunder"

(5, 2).clue: A dry spell that continues long enough to affect agriculture or other activities

(6, 2).clue: Prometheus' brother, you may know the fact he was cursed to bear the sky upon his back

(1, 3).clue: A school known as USC is in this state capital

(2, 3).clue: To save money, this star & exec. producer of "Major Dad" bought his TV wardrobe at Camp Pendleton

(4, 3).clue: This word for an assembly of witches comes from the same Latin root as convent

(5, 3).clue: The lake effect, most pronounced near the Great Lakes, causes this type of solid precipitation

(6, 3).clue: Imagine that, he had wings on his hat; & we could add this bit of news -- he also had them on his shoes

(1, 4).clue: Closest capital to the Comstock Lode

(2, 4).clue: You're too young to remember him as Dr. Kildare, but he also played Dr. Kulani on "Island Son"

(3, 4).clue: Pepys reported his wife & her friends played this game known as "Blind Fly" in Italy & "Blind Buck" in Sweden

(4, 4).clue: Meaning made or done in the Arabic fashion, this adjective is used in music, interior design & ballet

(5, 4).clue: The prevailing winds that blow across most of the U.S. come from this direction

(6, 4).clue: Juno cursed her, have you heard?  So she'll always have the very last word

(1, 5).clue: Major General Grenville Dodge named this Union Pacific terminal site after a local Indian tribe

(2, 5).clue: This teenage actress played Jerry Lee Lewis' teenage bride in "Great Balls of Fire!"

(3, 5).clue: In the Black Lady version of this game the Queen of Spades counts for 13 points

(4, 5).clue: You could be described as lupine if you resembled one of these animals

(5, 5).clue: Severe tropical storm having winds in excess of 74 MPH & an eye in the middle

(6, 5).clue: In the underworld he's busy still pushing a rock to the top of a hill

(1, 1).clue: Saturn's satellites help to keep these distinctive features intact

(2, 1).clue: By the end of "Salome" this character has lost his head

(3, 1).clue: Proprietors of the Carolinas hoped to raise worms to make this fabric, but the attempt failed

(4, 1).clue: Treasures from the tomb of Philip II of Macedon can be seen in Salonika, this country's 2nd largest city

(5, 1).clue: Ancient Chinese medical practice in which needles are inserted in the skin at key points

(1, 2).clue: Our atmosphere has 21% oxygen & a little of this gas; Venus has just a trace of oxygen & 95% this gas

(2, 2).clue: She marries King Mark, but Tristan is her consuming passion

(3, 2).clue: This country's neutrality was fully respected until 1798 when the French invaded

(4, 2).clue: Schwarzwald is the German name for this region noted for its mineral springs

(5, 2).clue: Both the Epstein-Barr virus & the cytomegalovirus cause this "kissing disease"

(1, 3).clue: Astronomers think the Andromeda Spiral may have one of these collapsed stars at its center

(2, 3).clue: In English the title of this Richard Strauss opera is "The Knight of the Rose"

(3, 3).clue: This country lost Minorca, Sicily & Gibraltar when it signed the Treaty of Utrecht

(4, 3).clue: This London park has a "Speaker's Corner" where anyone can voice his opinions on any subject

(5, 3).clue: The cervical spine has 7, the thoracic spine - 12, the lumbar spine - 5, the sacrum - 5, & the coccyx - 4

(1, 4).clue: During a total eclipse this part of the sun, ordinarily not visible, can be seen

(2, 4).clue: Berlioz's opera about "The Damnation Of" this man features the "Dance of the Sylphs"

(3, 4).clue: He discovered New Zealand & spent 6 mos. there before exploring Australia & its Great Barrier Reef

(4, 4).clue: Fluency in this Romance language would be useful when visiting the Republic of San Marino

(5, 4).clue: The A.M.A. says most fatal cases of poisoning from these in the U.S. are caused by the death cap variety

(1, 5).clue: Using this method, in 1838 F.W. Bessel was first to gauge the distance between Earth & a star accurately

(2, 5).clue: In the last scene of "The Maid Of Orleans", a fire is lit in this city

(3, 5).clue: Robert Clive was one of the major architects of British power in this colony

(4, 5).clue: This travel editor's "guides" now total over 80 titles, many of which are published annually

(5, 5).clue: Athletes who use these steroids to bulk up muscles risk damage to the adrenal glands & liver

(0, 0).clue: Son of a famous poet, this oldest justice ever didn't retire until he was 90
